story:
Here's Roxanne Mejia's career story:

Roxanne Mejia's culinary journey began in 2013 at Anthony's @ Point Defiance, where she cut her teeth in a fast-paced kitchen environment. Starting from basic tasks like operating fryers and grills, she quickly distinguished herself through her attention to detail and ability to maintain high food quality standards. During her three years there, she developed strong organizational skills and eventually moved into mentoring new staff members.

In 2017, Roxanne's talents earned her a promotion to Sous Chef at a high-volume restaurant. In this role, she managed a team of 25-30 staff members, including cooks, bakers, and dishwashers. She became known for building strong vendor relationships and streamlining kitchen processes, which significantly improved wait times and customer satisfaction. Her ability to maintain quality while optimizing costs caught the attention of senior management.

Since 2020, Roxanne has served as Chef, where she's truly come into her own as a kitchen leader. She oversees all aspects of kitchen operations, from staff training to menu development. Her particular strengths lie in cost control and budget management, working closely with the General Manager to analyze food costs and forecast business trends. She's especially skilled at handling dietary restrictions and food allergies, ensuring every guest receives a meal that meets their specific needs.

Throughout her career, Roxanne has maintained a consistent focus on food quality, safety, and team development. Her journey from line cook to Chef showcases her growth not only as a culinary professional but also as a leader who can motivate teams and maintain high standards in demanding kitchen environments.

This progression, built on a foundation of her High School Diploma from Curtis Senior High School in 2004, demonstrates Roxanne's commitment to the culinary arts and her ability to rise through the ranks through hard work and dedication.
